chargeHist.descr: Neglecting a Child (Consequence is Great Bodily Harm)
Neglecting a Child (Consequence is Great Bodily Harm)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler James Fjelstad was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Reckless Probab./Great Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- 189 days credit against ultimate sentence

- In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with Ct 1 in 22CM186, Ct 1 in 20CM990, & Ct 1 in 20CM656.

miscConds.notes:
- $268 Court Costs.  Payable through DOC on Count 1 in St Croix County case 21CF177
- $250 DNA Surcharge.  Payable through DOC on Count 1 in St Croix County case 21CF177

- Absolute sobriety
- DNA Sample
- Test randomly and regularly
- Defendant to apply for treatment court, if accepted go through process, if denied Court reserves right to order it.  DE to complete application and turn in within the next 2 weeks. 
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting. 
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol. 
- Follow any current Orders associated with contacts in Family case or Civil case
- Complete Moral Reconation Therapy (MRT) or an equivalent cognitive skills program. 
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or programs as requested
- Pay Supervision Fees

timeConds.notes: - 2 months STAYED.  First 60 days without Huber after 60 days Huber approved for treatment and work purposes.

Conditions of Probation:

- 10 Months County Jail- 2 months STAYED.  First 60 days without Huber after 60 days Huber approved for treatment or work purposes. 
- Absolute sobriety
- Test randomly and regularly
- DE to apply for treatment court, if accepted go through process, if denied Court reserves right to order it.  DE to complete application and turn in within the next 2 weeks. 
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol
- Follow any current Orders associated with contacts in Family case or Civil case
- Complete Moral Reconation Therapy (MRT) or an equivalent cognitive skills program. 
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- Pay supervision fees

189 days credit against ultimate sentence.

Sentencing hearing on September 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:08 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Tyler James Fjelstad in court, in custody.  Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Tyler James Fjelstad. Includes 22CM186, 22CF75 & 22CF177.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to AMENDED Ct 1: Physical Abuse of Child- 948.21(3c) in 22CF177 and Guilty to Count 1:Take and Drive Vehicle without consent- 943.23(3m). DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE Guilty to AMENDED Ct 1: Recklessly causes bodily harm to child- 948.03(3)(c) in 22CF177 and Guilty to Count 1:Take and Drive Vehicle without consent- 943.23(3m) 22CM186. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses and read- in Ct 2 in case 22CM186 and Cts 1-4 in case 22CF75. Court revokes bail and remand DE.  Court orders PSI to be completed by DOC by 9/19/22.  ADA Ballo requesting to have 20CM656 & 20CM990 included in PSI.  Clerk to include those files in PSI.  If other court officials for those files agree, this court will hear those matters at sentencing.  Adjourned at 10:37 AM. bph
Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

11:34 AM  Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: Unmonitored DAR, Clerk: Benoy   ADA:   Michael Joseph Becker    DF:  Tyler James Fjelstad appeared from jail.  INCLUDES: 22CF75 & 22CF177.  Originally set for Preliminary hearings.  Court questions DF re: PD qualification.  States he was told at the last hearing he was eligible for a PD.  Court will set for hearing today during intake.  Court makes good cause finding.  Adjourned: 11:38   Case Recalled:  11:49   ADA:   Michael Joseph Becker    DF:  Tyler James Fjelstad appeared from jail.  Atty Satorius now appears for DF.   Atty Satorious states DF wishes to waive the Preliminary hearing in 22CF75 & 22CF177.    Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Bond continues.  Adjourned:  11:53  Arraignment scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

Includes 22CF75 and 22CF177

 - Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, I.M.F (with any of his children or mother or any other children in the home or under his care).  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

  I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random Drug testing 1 time per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.
